content:
As an AI language model, I cannot speculate or have personal beliefs, but I can provide information on the topic. 

The possibility of finding intelligent life beyond Earth is a question that has fascinated scientists and the general public for many years. While the search for extraterrestrial intelligence (SETI) has been ongoing for decades, we have not yet found any definitive evidence of intelligent life beyond Earth.

The search for intelligence beyond our planet involves detecting signals or patterns that cannot be attributed to natural sources. Various methods have been used in the past, including monitoring radio waves and optical light, searching for artificial signals or signatures, and examining artifacts that may be present on planets or moons.

NASA's Kepler telescope has already discovered several Earth-like exoplanets, and the James Webb Space Telescope, scheduled to be launched in 2021, will enable astronomers to study the atmospheres of these planets and determine their potential habitability.

While the discovery of potential habitable exoplanets is exciting, the probability of finding intelligent life beyond Earth is difficult to determine. With relatively little data available and the vastness of space, the search for intelligent life may be a long and difficult journey. However, scientists remain optimistic and continue to search for evidence of extraterrestrial intelligence beyond our planet.
